title: Kazi Tanvir Hasan
text:
As a PhD student at the Department of Biostatistics in Florida International University, I have developed a strong research interest in a variety of fields, including Data Science, Machine learning, Disease Modeling and Bayesian Analysis. Throughout my academic career, I have been dedicated to pursuing innovative research projects that contribute to advancing knowledge in these areas. With a deep passion for statistical modeling and analysis, I am eager to continue exploring complex problems and developing innovative solutions that can have a positive impact on human health and well-being.

title: Kazi Tanvir Hasan
text:
Work Experience

Graduate Assistant
Department of Biostatistics, Florida International University
August 2021 - Present
• Prepare a class for Introduction to Bayesian Analysis (PHC6084)
• Work on research projects under faculty supervision, including conducting literature reviews, collecting and analyzing data, and preparing research reports or papers
• Lead discussion sections, hold office hours, develop course materials, and assist with course logistics


Research Assistant
Department of Disaster Science and Climate Resilience, University of Dhaka
January 2021 - July 2021
• Data collection, data cleaning and visualizations
• Statistical data analysis for reports and scientific manuscripts


Graduate Teaching Assistant
Department of Mathematics, Illinois State University
August 2018 - May 2020
• Lead discussion sections, tutorials, or laboratory sections
• Evaluate and grade examinations, assignments, or papers and record grades.
• Schedule and maintain regular office hours to meet with students
• Prepare or proctor examinations
• Meet with supervisors to discuss students’ grades or to complete required grade related paperwork.
